victim.ante:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (ANTE period - before collision).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Environment": "Describe road conditions, weather, visibility, and traffic density.",
  "POV Vehicle Behavior": "Describe how the POV vehicle is moving and interacting with the environment.",
  "Traffic Situation": "Identify other vehicles nearby and their relative positions.",
  "Narrative": "Combine the above into a cohesive story of the moments leading up to the incident."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe other vehicles by color/type (e.g., "red sedan").
victim.event:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (EVENT period - the collision).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Sequence of Events": "Describe the exact sequence of events during the collision. How did it happen?",
  "Vehicles Involved": "Identify all parties. Refer to the dashcam source ONLY as 'POV vehicle'. Describe others by appearance.",
  "Impact Dynamics": "Describe the point of impact and immediate vehicle responses.",
  "Fault Assignment": "Based on visual evidence, provide a reasoned assignment of fault. Explain why a specific vehicle (POV vehicle or another) is responsible based on observed behavior or traffic rules."
}

Be detailed and objective. This is the MOST IMPORTANT section.
victim.post:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (POST period - after collision).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Scene Status": "Describe vehicle positions after impact and any secondary hazards created.",
  "POV Vehicle Response": "Describe actions taken by the POV vehicle immediately following the crash.",
  "Final State": "Describe the final resting positions of all involved parties and the environment."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe other vehicles by appearance.

offender.ante:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (ANTE period).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "POV Vehicle Actions": "Describe speed, lane changes, or any aggressive maneuvers taken by the POV vehicle.",
  "Environment": "Describe road conditions and traffic flow from the POV vehicle's perspective.",
  "Hazards": "Describe any obstacles the POV vehicle may have missed or misjudged.",
  "Narrative": "Combine the above into a story explaining the POV vehicle's path leading to the incident."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe other vehicles by appearance.
offender.event:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (EVENT period).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Collision Narrative": "Describe how the POV vehicle initiated or failed to avoid the collision.",
  "Point of Impact": "Describe where the POV vehicle struck the other party.",
  "Evasive Actions": "Describe any last-second (or lack thereof) attempts by the POV vehicle to brake or swerve.",
  "Fault Analysis": "Objectively describe how the POV vehicle's actions led to the fault assignment."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe others by appearance.
offender.post:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (POST period).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Stopping": "Describe how quickly the POV vehicle came to a halt.",
  "Damage": "Provide a visual assessment of the damage caused by the POV vehicle to others and itself.",
  "Final Scene": "Describe the final resting position of the POV vehicle relative to the victims."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe others by appearance.

witness.ante:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (ANTE period). The POV vehicle is a bystander.

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Observed Vehicles": "Identify the vehicles ahead or around the POV vehicle that will later collide.",
  "Their Behavior": "Describe any erratic or noteworthy driving by those vehicles before the crash.",
  "POV Status": "Describe the POV vehicle's role as a passive observer in traffic."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe the third-party vehicles by appearance.
witness.event:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (EVENT period). The POV vehicle is a bystander.

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Incident Narrative": "Describe the collision between the third-party vehicles as seen from the POV vehicle.",
  "POV Safety": "Note that the POV vehicle was NOT involved in the impact.",
  "Dynamics": "Describe how the colliding vehicles moved and interacted with each other.",
  "Fault Assignment": "Assign fault between the third-party vehicles involved in the crash."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle".
witness.post:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (POST period). The POV vehicle is a bystander.

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "POV Actions": "Describe whether the POV vehicle pulls over to help or capture the scene.",
  "Scene Status": "Describe the positions of the colliding vehicles after they have come to rest.",
  "Secondary Hazards": "Describe any risks to other traffic (including the POV vehicle) created by the crash."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle".
